autopdex.seeder.quasi_random_in_psdfÔÉÅ

autopdex.seeder.quasi_random_in_psdf(psdf, min, max, n_seeds, mode, atol=1e-08, n_init=10000, approx=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generates quasi-random seed points and filters them using psdf.

Parameters:

  • psdf (function) ‚Äì Positive smooth distance function.

  • min (array) ‚Äì Minimum coordinates.

  • max (array) ‚Äì Maximum coordinates.

  • n_seeds (int) ‚Äì Number of seed points.

  • mode (str) ‚Äì Sampling mode (‚Äòhammersley‚Äô or ‚Äòhalton‚Äô).

  • atol (float, optional) ‚Äì Absolute tolerance. Defaults to 1e-8.

  • n_init (int, optional) ‚Äì Initial number of points for fill ratio estimation. Defaults to 10000.

  • approx (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to approximate the number of seeds. Defaults to True.

Returns:

Filtered seed points, number of seeds, and estimated region size.

Return type:

tuple
